data.title: Ancestry of Dick Cheney (b. 1941)
data.text:
Ancestry of Richard Bruce Cheney by William Addams Reitwiesner

The following material on the immediate ancestry of Richard Cheney should not be considered either exhaustive or definitive, but rather as a first draft.

Robert Battle and Tom Gede contributed to this report.

William Addams Reitwiesner

wargs@wargs.com

Ancestry of Richard Bruce Cheney 1 Richard Bruce Cheney, b. Lincoln, Neb., 30 Jan. 1941, Representative from Wyoming 1979-1989, U.S. Secretary of Defense 1989-1993, U.S. Vice President from 2001

m. ... 29 Aug. 1964

Lynne Ann Vincent, b. Casper, Wyo., 14 Aug 1941, dau. of Wayne Edwin Vincent and of Edna Lolita Lybyer. Further details of her ancestry can be found here. PARENTS 2 Richard Herbert Cheney, b. ... Neb., 26 June 1915, living with parents in Dawson Co., Neb., in 1920, living with parents in Dawson Co., Neb., in 1930, d. Casper, Wyo., 23 May 1999 [SSDI 508-36-1537]

m. 3 Marjorie Lorraine Dickey, b. ... , Neb. 8 Jan. 1918, living with parents in Otoe Co., Neb., in 1920, living with parents in Otoe Co., Neb., in 1930, d. Casper, Wyo., 26 Dec. 1993 [SSDI 506-03-7524] GRANDPARENTS 4 Thomas Herbert Cheney, b. Defiance, Ohio, 10 Apr. 1869, a bank clerk living in Dawson Co., Neb., in 1900, a bank cashier living in Dawson Co., Neb., in 1920, a Cashier, Bank, living in Dawson Co., Neb., in 1930, d. Sumner, Neb., 29 March 1947 [Pope 479 (p. 193)]

m. (2) ... 20 May 1914 5 Margaret Ellen Tyler, b. Franklin, Ind., 16 June 1877, living with parents in Dawson Co., Neb., in 1880, a teacher living with parents in Dawson Co., Neb., in 1900, living with husband in Dawson Co., Neb., in 1920, living with husband in Dawson Co., Neb., in 1930, d. Casper, Wyo., 28 Apr. 1961 6 David E ... Dickey, b. ... Neb., ... Dec. 1889, in 1900 living with his father in Otoe Co., Neb., in 1920 a butcher in Otoe Co., Neb., in 1930 a trucker in Otoe Co., Neb.

m. 7 Clarice E ... ----, b. ... , Neb., ... 1889, in 1920 living with her husband, in 1930 living with her husband GREAT-GRANDPARENTS 8 Samuel Fletcher Cheney, b. Boscawen, N.H., 2 Dec. 1829, Captain of Co. B, 21st Ohio Infantry in the Civil War, in 1897 residing in Amherst, Logan Township, Buffalo Co., Neb., a farmer living in Buffalo Co., Neb., in 1900, [Pope 291 (p. 167)]

m. Defiance, Ohio, 24 Sept. 1861 9 Ella A. Phillips, b. ... N.Y., ... Feb. 1840, living with husband in Buffalo Co., Neb., in 1900 10 James Alexander Tyler, b. ... , Ind., 6 May 1848, living in Dawson Co., Neb., in 1880, a farmer living in Dawson Co., Neb., in 1900, d. ... 1909

m. ... 1869 11 Sarah Elizabeth Swift, b. ... , Ind., 15 March 1843, living with husband in Dawson Co., Neb., in 1880, living with husband in Dawson Co., Neb., in 1900, d. ... 1904 12 Edward Alonzo "Lon" Dickey, b. Ray Co., Mo., 28 Aug. 1859, in 1900 a farmer in Otoe Co., Neb., in 1920 living with son Otoe Co., Neb., d. ... 1 May 1923, bur. Rosewood Cemetery, Otoe Co., Neb.

m. (Lancaster, Neb., 19 July 1888? IGI) 13 Laura Dillman, b. ... , Iowa, ... 1858, d. ... 1900, bur. Rosewood Cemetery, Otoe Co., Neb. 14 ---- , b. ... Iowa, ...

m. (dau. b. Neb. 1889) 15 ---- , b. ... , Tenn., ... GREAT-GREAT-GRANDPARENTS 16 Elias Eaton Cheney, a joiner and carpenter, b. Campton, N.H., 30 May 1793, d. Thetford, Vt., 2 Feb. 1859 [Pope 153 (pp. 131-132)]

m. 17 Lucy Fletcher, b. Thetford, Vt., 21 Apr. 1803 [Fletcher 858 (p. 79)] 18 Jeremiah W ... Phillips, b. ... , Vt., ... [ca. 1814]

m. 19 Louisa ----, b. ... , N.Y., ... [ca. 1812] 20 Willett Tyler, b. ... , Ky., 26 Feb. 1808, living in Dawson Co., Neb., in 1880, d. ... 1882

m. 21 Rachel A. Montgomery, b. ... , Ky., 24 Sept. 1810, apparently dead by 1880 (husband remarried by then) 22 Thomas Swift, b. ... , Ky., ...

m. 23 Margaret Hill, b. ... , Ky., ... 24 Eli G (rover?) Dickey, b. IN/MO ca. 1828/9, d. Richmond, Ray Co., Mo., 6 May 1886

m. before 1856 25 Martha Ann McGaugh, b. Ray Co., Mo., 4 Jan. 1839 d. ... GREAT-GREAT-GREAT-GRANDPARENTS 32 Ebenezer Cheney, b. Newbury, Mass., 24 Feb. 1764, d. Campton, N.H., 3 Aug. 1832 [Pope 77 [should be 78] (p. 103)]

m. Campton, N.H., 3 Aug. 1789 33 Hannah Eaton, of Meredith, N.H., 4 Dec. 1761 [IGI], d. Campton, N.H., 14 Jan. 1832 34 Joseph Fletcher, b. Dunstable, Mass., 7 Nov. 1777, d. Thetford, Vt., 10 May 1861 [Fletcher 742 (p. 79)]

m. ... 22 July 1802 35 Rachel Emerson, b. Dunstable, Mass., 6 Oct. 1781, d. Thetford, Vt., 7 Apr. 1863 [James p. 64] 40 Robert Tyler, b. Lexington, Ky., 12 March 1773

m. Shelby Co., Ky., 25 Feb. 1794 41 Sarah Pritchard, b. Baltimore, Md., ca. 1775 44 John Swift

m. 45 Eunice Parkhurst 48 James Dickey, b. Caswell Co., N.C., 20 Apr. 1788, d. Ray Co., Mo., 4 Aug. 1857

m. Rutherford Co., Tenn., 23 Oct. 1810 49 Mary Wells, b. ca. 1791/2, d. Ray Co., Mo., 29 July 1837 50 Thomas H ... McGaugh, b. Davidson Co., Tenn., 10 July 1810, d. Ray Co., Mo., 28 Aug 1872

m. Ray Co., Mo., 2 June 1836 51 Margaret Wall, b. KY/VA 4 April 1812, d. 21 May 1890 GREAT-GREAT-GREAT-GREAT-GRANDPARENTS 64 William Cheney, b. Newbury, Mass., 8 Sept. 1741, d. Grand Menan Island, New Brunswick, 4 Apr. 1803 [Pope 40 (pp. 81-82)]

m. Newbury, Mass., 17 Apr. 1763 65 Elizabeth Sweet/Swett, b. Newbury, Mass., 24 Nov. 1745 66 Jacob Eaton, b. Mass. ca. 1735, d. N.H. post 1800

m. 1754 67 Esther Colby 68 Jonathan Fletcher, b. Dunstable, Mass., 30 March 1741, d. Dunstable, Mass., 30 March 1813 [Fletcher 685 (pp. 58-60)]

m. Dunstable, Mass., 9 Feb. 1764 69 Lucy Taylor, b. Dunstable, Mass., 4 Apr. 1742, d. Dunstable, Mass., 17 July 1801 70 Jonathan Emerson, b. Haverhill, Mass., 25 Dec. 1744, d. Dunstable, Mass., either 10 Oct. 1785 (gravestone) or 11 Nov. 1785 (town record) [James 72 (p. 64)]

m. Dunstable, Mass., 5 March 1778 71 Mary Cummings, b. Dunstable, Mass., 16 Nov. 1760 80 Robert Tyler, b. Frederick Co., Va., 19 Aug. 1751, d. Tyler Station, Shelby Co., Ky., 16 April 1815, and bur. there [Newman pp. 190-191]

m. ca. 1772 81 Margaret ----, b. 15 March 1755, d. 14 Oct. 1840, bur. Tyler Station, Shelby Co., Ky. 82 James Pritchard, b. Baltimore, Md., 27 Dec. 1746, d. New Castle, Ky., 30 May 1821

m. Md. ca. 1774 83 Elizabeth Hughes, b. ca. 1750, d. New Castle, Ky., ca. 1801 88 Thomas Anderson Swift

m. 89 Frances Mann 96 David Dickey, b. NC ca. 1760, d. Rutherford Co., Tenn., ca. 1835

m. 97 Mary Logue Lindsay, b. ... 1764, d. Rutherford Co., Tenn., ... 98 James Wills, b. Chester Co., Pa., 17 July 1763, d. Ray Co Mo., 17 Aug. 1855

m. 99 Lillian Buchanan, b. ca. 1769 102 Edward Wall, b. Va. ca. 1786

m. 103 Bethelen McGath, b. Va. ca 1790 GREAT-GREAT-GREAT-GREAT-GREAT-GRANDPARENTS 128 Joseph Cheney, b. Cambridge, Mass., 2 Nov. 1709, drowned in 1776 [Pope 21 (pp. 65-66)]

m. 129 Elizabeth Tucker 130 Samuel Sweet/Swett, b. Newbury, Mass., 27 Oct. 1706, d. Newbury, Mass., 10 Aug. 1756

m. Newbury, Mass., 5 Aug. 1730 131 Elizabeth Adams, b. Newbury, Mass., 29 May 1706/7, d. Salisbury, Mass., before 1753 132 Jacob Eaton, d. Hampstead 1768, ae. 59

m. Westford, Mass., 21 May 1735 137 Elizabeth Underwood, b. Chelmsford, Mass., 2 Feb. 1714, d. Dunstable, Mass., 23 Nov. 1802 [Underwood pp. 11-12] 138 Samuel Taylor, b. Concord, Mass., 1 Oct. 1708, d. Dunstable, Mass., 23 Oct. 1792

m. ca. 1733 139 Susannah Perham, b. Dunstable, Mass., 15 Apr. 1712, d. Dunstable, Mass., 14 Oct. 1798 140 Timothy Emerson, b. Haverhill, Mass., 30 Nov. 1705, d. Haverhill, Mass., 17 Sept. 1775 [James 21 (pp. 37-38)]

m. Middlesex Co., Mass., ca. 1760 143 Mary ----, d. after 1 Feb. 1776 160 Edward Tyler, b. Queen Anne's Parish, Prince George's Co., Md., 18 Jan. 1719/20, d. 1802, bur. Jefferson Co., Ky. [Newman pp. 181-182]

m. Charlestown, Mass., 14 Nov. 1706 257 Mary Harbert, d. Ashford, Conn., 15 May 1760 258 Joseph Tucker

FURTHER NOTES

The National Society of the Daughters of the American Revolution (NSDAR) publishes a Patriot Index, a list of persons whose honorable service in the cause of independence during the American Revolution renders their female descendants eligible for membership in the NSDAR. Several ancestors of Dick Cheney appear in the Patriot Index, including:

Archibald Buchanan (number 198)

William Cheney (number 64)

Jacob Eaton (number 66)

Jonathan Emerson (number 70)

Jonathan Fletcher (number 68)

Joseph Fletcher (number 136)

James Pritchard (number 82)

Thomas Swift (number 176)

Samuel Taylor (number 138)

Edward Tyler (number 160)

Robert Tyler (number 80)

James Wills (number 98)

While Mr. Cheney is not eligible for membership in the NSDAR (by not being female), he is eligible for membership in the equivalent organization for men, the National Society of the Sons of the American Revolution.

SOURCES CONSULTED AND CITED

Adams -- A genealogical history of Henry Adams of Braintree, Mass [Rutland, Vt.: Tuttle, 1898].

Brigham -- Theda Page Brigham, Descendants of John Page (1614-1687) [Haverhill, N.H.: Haverhill Historical Society, 1972]. Separate Appendix volume published in 1979.

Fletcher -- Edward H. Fletcher, Fletcher Genealogy [Boston: Mudge, 1871].

James -- Jane Emerson James, The Haverhill Emersons [Lake Winnebago, Mo.: James, 1983].

Newman -- Harry Wright Newman, Mareen Duvall of Middle Plantation [Washington, D.C.: Newman, 1952].

Pope -- Charles Henry Pope, The Cheney Genealogy [Boston: Pope, 1897].

Stafford -- Morgan Hewitt Stafford, A genealogy of the Kidder family [Rutland, Vt.: Tuttle, 19??].

Stowell -- William Henry Harrison Stowell, "Four generations of descendants of Jonathan Hyde of Newton, Mass.", The New England Historical and Genealogical Register, vol. 71 (July 1917), p. 257 et seq.

Underwood -- Lucien Marcus Underwood, The Underwood familes of America [Lancaster, Pa.: New Era, 1913].

Warner -- Frederick Chester Warner, The ancestry of Samuel, Freda, and John Warner [Boston, Mass.: 1949].
